channel.title: JNI Spec
channel.description:
There seems to be differences between the JNI spec and the headers that I've got in my include directory. See here: http://download.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/guides/jni/spec/functions.html#wp17265
That should link you directly to the documentation for the GetStringUTFChars function, however in all the JNI specs I've managed to find it says that the function takes 3 arguments and returns a [i]const *jbyte[/i] from 1.3 up to 6.0, however according to the header file that I have the function only takes 2 arguments and returns a [i]const *char[/i]. Have I missed something somewhere? Or did I just manage to download a version of the JDK that includes a different version of the JNI to any other release.

item.title: JNI Spec
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

if you are using c++ it only takes 2 arguments

Read full topic

item.title: JNI Spec
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

There seems to be differences between the JNI spec and the headers that I’ve got in my include directory.
See here: http://download.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/guides/jni/spec/functions.html#wp17265

That should link you directly to the documentation for the GetStringUTFChars function, however in all the JNI specs I’ve managed to find it says that the function takes 3 arguments and returns a const *jbyte from 1.3 up to 6.0, however according to the header file that I have the function only takes 2 arguments and returns a const *char. Have I missed something somewhere? Or did I just manage to download a version of the JDK that includes a different version of the JNI to any other release.

Read full topic
